pr_title: Delete index API properly handles backing indices for data streams

timeline.author: martijnvg

timeline.bodyText: nit: use assertThat(...) with isNull() as matcher instead? I think in general that is the preferred way of writing test assertions.
timeline.author: martijnvg

timeline.bodyText: maybe also assert that the index that is supposed to be removed really is removed? I think we now just check that all other indices but the removed index exists. I think that for that, just checking that the number of backing indices is decremented by 1 should suffice.
timeline.author: martijnvg

timeline.bodyText: I think that instead of looping here just checking that the index that is supposed to be removed is removed and checking that the number of indices is decremented by one is sufficient.
timeline.author: martijnvg

timeline.bodyText: Would be good to assert that backingIndices.size() == indices.size() - 1?
timeline.author: henningandersen
